channel.title: Help (Repost)
channel.description:
I dont think this belonged in the SCAR section so i post it here. ( Since i cant remove my topic)
Hello.
I was looking in my scar script folder, when i opened up one of them and played them. It had an auto click on the one of the buttons on your internet explorer And i clicked the shut button ( ON MY PC) And now..
I CANT EVEN TURN ON MY COMPUTER.
IT comes up with
safe mode ect.. Start windows normal
Windows will start normally in : 20
And when it starts up for a few seconds then restarts automaticly. In a black screen
Could someone tell me why? and how to fix?!!!!!
PS. I typed this on my labtop.

But kaitnieks isnt around :’(

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

wonderguy6:

Only, Dylock and freddy would know

Or Kaitnieks but I’m certain Kaitnieks wouldn’t implement a way of running a script on SCAR startup.

Read full topic

item.title: Help (Repost)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:13, topic:71868”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=105607.msg1062762#msg1062762 date=1175196763]

Try not pressing the f8 key when starting up? I can guarentee it wasn’t SCAR that did this.

If the computer turned off… Scar couldnt run right? Try loading it normally, or grab a back up drive and use that for now…

SCAR can’t run unless you or another program opens it and there is no way to have a script run automatically.
[/quote]

Put the script and scar into an exe then put it into startup? but then again it cant press the run button
so your correct. Ignore me![/quote]

I have no idea if that was suppose to be sarcastic but let me try and explain:

There is no current way to run a script in SCAR automatically. You can load a script and even change the default script, but you can’t run a script unless you press the green play button.

However, if you turned a script into an exe, then yes it would be possible but I’m sure SCAR isn’t powerful enough to build an exe.

Read full topic

item.title: Help (Repost)
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:10, topic:71868”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=105607.msg1062725#msg1062725 date=1175194876]

Try not pressing the f8 key when starting up? I can guarentee it wasn’t SCAR that did this.

If the computer turned off… Scar couldnt run right? Try loading it normally, or grab a back up drive and use that for now…
[/quote]

SCAR can’t run unless you or another program opens it and there is no way to have a script run automatically.[/quote]

Put the script and scar into an exe then put it into startup? but then again it cant press the run button
so your correct. Ignore me!

Read full topic

item.title: Help (Repost)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:9, topic:71868”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=105607.msg1062589#msg1062589 date=1175186370]
Try not pressing the f8 key when starting up? I can guarentee it wasn’t SCAR that did this.
[/quote]
If the computer turned off… Scar couldnt run right? Try loading it normally, or grab a back up drive and use that for now…[/quote]

SCAR can’t run unless you or another program opens it and there is no way to have a script run automatically.

Read full topic

item.title: Help (Repost)
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

The Wise Guy:

The button you click to turn on your computer…

OHHH! THAT BUTTON!

Well. This probelem has nothing to do with scar itself. This happend to me Move the highliter thinggy onto safemode, press enter. wait wait wait wait wait wait wait wait (other words wait for a long time)

Your system will restart then boot prefectly fine

Same thing happend to me when i tried to boot from a cd once.

Read full topic
